result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 02-22-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

With credit for 6 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

***Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successfully completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion
Consecutive to: any sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd M Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successfully completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.
(2).  On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Todd M Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  CLARIFYING COMMUNITY SERVICE:  Defendant was to have completed THIRTEEN (13) HOURS not TWELVE (12).  Defendant has remaining ONE (1) HOUR of Community Service.  Court went off the Record to allow time for Counsel to confer.  State advised that Defendant was to produce a prescription for medication.  Defendant insisted he DID in fact produce his actual medication bottles.  Defense Counsel conformed that he HAS seen the prescription bottles.  Defense reported that Defendant contacted his Attorney when at a medical appointment to make sure that the medication prescribed would not void his DPA.    

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the state Court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED and READ-IN for Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:

On motion of the State,  Court ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction as to Count 2.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve SIX (6) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for SIX (6) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 02-22-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Todd M Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court reviewed the proffered documents.  State advised that Defendant has Community Service remaining.  The State has reduced the overall amount to TWENTY-FIVE (25) HOURS.  Defendant has remaining TWELVE (12) Hours to complete.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Todd M Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Letters from North Bay Lodge, received and filed.   Defendant to complete community service.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. tk
No Gun or Drug Order signed received and filed. tk

Defendant Todd M Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed. Court ordered defendant no longer to be monitored by Justice Point for pretrial services.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.   All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated July 1, 2015 received and filed. tk
Letter received on 06/12/2015 in regards to Mr. Thomas' treatment filed

Cash bond to remain at $100.00. 
Additional conditions of bail to include defendant is to begin treatment at Hope Haven by June 5, 2015. Defense to present documentation in writing to Court of treatment by June 8, 2015. If defendant is participating in treatment at Hope Haven then defendant is not required to attend appointments with Justice Point. However defendant must notify counsel immediately, which then counsel must notify Court, if status of treatment changes.

Case set for plea and sentencing. Defense requesting additonal time for defendant to be accepted into treatment. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case held off the record. Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. For the reasons presented to the Court the case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 4-23-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case is adjourned for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 4-3-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17. 
Court reviews Justice Point and REITERATES that the defendant may NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Todd M Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Todd M Thomas in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
